ranked_diseases.explanation: Neurofibromatosis Type 1 (NF1) is characterized by the presence of plexiform neurofibromas, freckling in unusual places, and multiple cafe-au-lait spots, matching all the presented phenotypic features.

Legius Syndrome can present with multiple cafe-au-lait spots and freckling, but it is less commonly associated with plexiform neurofibromas compared to NF1. It is considered due to the overlap in skin findings.
